Award.AwardTitle: International Conference on Stem Cell Engineering 2016; October 23-26, 2016; Toronta, Canada

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
1644616-Gerecht

NSF has made an award in support of registration fees and travel costs for invited speakers and students to attend the "International Conference on Stem Cell Engineering 2016 (ICSCE 2016)" being held in the Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville, Toronto, Canada, October 23-26, 2016. This unique multidisciplinary conference, with approximately 150 attendees expected, brings together biologists, physician-scientists and engineers to discuss ways in which their disciplines can collaborate to find novel solutions to stem cell engineering problems. Of special importance are identifying fundamental studies needed to translate findings into clinical practice, e.g., 1) approaches to monitor stem cell responses, 2) enhancement of regeneration through material properties, 3) assessing the immunological response during regeneration, and 4) the accurate design of clinical trials. Aims are to provide a venue for: 1) growing the scientific exchange among Stem Cell Engineering researchers; 2) scientific presentations from a diverse group of leading biology, chemistry and engineering researchers who cover the breadth of Stem Cell Engineering; 3) interactions between academic and industry researchers, who bring different approaches and perspectives to the field; 4) interactions between clinicians and scientists working towards understanding stem cells towards regenerative medicine therapeutics; 5) active participation and networking of Ph.D. students and postdoctoral researchers, who represent the future of Stem Cell Engineering; and 6)bringing scientists and engineers together to provide an atmosphere and venue to discuss their disciplines and approaches, and to motivate new research into barriers limiting the development of Stem Cell technologies. The meeting will be publicized via a conference web site and announcements will be sent to SBE and AIChE Division 15 (Food, Pharmaceutical and Bioengineering) members, previous conference attendees and prominent academic and industry researchers in the field. These publicity platforms will also be used to solicit applications for student/postdoc travel awards, which will be reviewed on the bases of merit, need, and participation of women, underrepresented minorities, and persons with disabilities. Conference proceedings will be produced and made available online. This is the first in a series of conferences expected to be held every two years

POR.DRECONTENT:
International Conference on Stem Cell Engineering 2016 was held from October 23-26, 2016 at the Toronto Marriott Bloor Yorkville, Ontario, Canada. It was organized jointly by the Society for Biological Engineering. The conference was chaired by: Karen Christman, University of California San Diego, USA and Sharon Gerecht, Johns Hopkins University, USA. The Organizing Committee, ensured a quality technical program and the overall success of the conference.

Organizing Committee:

  • Milica Radisic, University of Toronto
  • Joseph Wu, Stanford University
  • Sean Palecek, University of Wisconsin-Madison
  • Jason Burdick, University of Pennsylvania
  • Hai-Quan Mao, Johns Hopkins University
  • Song Li, University of California, Los Angeles
  • Shyni Varghese, University of California San Diego

International Conference on Stem Cell Engineering 2016 (Stem Cell 2016) followed the successes of the previous four conferences, with the prior event (Stem Cell Engineering 2014) held in 2014 in Coronado Island Marriott, Coronado, CA. Stem Cell 2016 brought together 85 attendees, with international representation, who shared state-of-the-art developments and achievements made in the field of Stem Cell Engineering. These attendees are experts that are top class academic researchers, highly regarded industrial scientists and engineers as well as physician-scientists. There were a significant number of graduate students, postdoctoral fellows and young professionals.

The technical program included 8 keynote presentations, 40 invited presentations and over 15 posters presentations presented in the evening poster sessions. Technical sessions integrated talks discussing the recent achievements made in the fields of In situ/endogenous regeneration, Differentiation & Morphogenesis, Microtechnologies & High Throughput Screening/Disease models, Computational Stem Cell Biology, Immune engineering, Clinical applications and challenges and Regenerative Therapies.

In addition to the technical program there was 2 Posters Awards presented to:

  1. The 1st Place Student poster award in Stem Cell Engineering was presented to Michael Blatchley, Johns Hopkins University to recognize his poster presentation.
  2. The 2nd Place Student poster award in Stem Cell Engineering was presented to Joel Ostblom, University of Toronto to recognize his poster presentation.

Complete information about the conference (Including online technical program, Organizing comittee, speakers bio) and access to the conference proceedings can be found on the conference website at https://www.aiche.org/sbe/conferences/international-conference-on-stem-cell-engineering/2016.

Press Coverage: Chari Sheila, Cell Press & Elsevier
